newsitem.title: UK: Korean Air starts Seoul-Sydney cargo flights April.
newsitem.headline: Korean Air starts Seoul-Sydney cargo flights April.

text.p: Korean Air Lines said it will inaugurate a weekly Seoul-Sydney McDonnell Douglas MD-11 freighter service from April 2.
The carrier's UK cargo sales manager Frank Smith told Reuters that of the 60 tonnes-plus cargo capacity on each flight, about 22 tonnes would be allocated to Europe-originating cargo.
The remainder, he added, would be shared between the United States, Korea and the rest of Asia.
"Tomorrow's flight is fully booked, with 62 tonnes of cargo aboard," he said.
The MD-11F is one of seven passenger aircraft purchased by Korean Air about five years ago, five of which have since been designated for all-cargo use, noted Smith.
"We have now converted two of the MD-11s into freighter configuration and the other three will follow over the next two to three years," he said.

Korean Air sources said that machinery and other industrial and computer-related cargo would comprise the bulk of shipments into Australia on the new flights, while the carrier would be targeting perishable goods and outbound freight from the country.
-- Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706; fax +5017
